name: Athletics
detail: The athletics track at the Olympic Stadium is a 400m oval. For all track events the finish line is in the same place, at the end of the ‘home straight’.

name: Badminton
detail: Unlike other net sports, badminton uses a shuttlecock instead of a ball. A shuttlecock is an open conical object formed by goose feathers embedded in a rounded cork base.

name: Basketball
detail: Basketball is played by two teams of five players on a 28mx15m court with players looking to score by shooting the ball into a basket.

name: Boxing
detail: Two athletes square up to each other in a ring, and victory is gained by the athlete who more successfully lands blows to their opponent's head and torso.

name: Cycling Road
detail: Cycling road has been included at nearly all Olympic Games since 1896 apart from a 12-year period where it was excluded before returning for Stockholm 1912.

name: Equestrian
detail: Equestrian featured in the Paris 1900 Games, but its official debut took place at Stockholm 1912. Individual and team medals are awarded in each of the three equestrian disciplines.

name: Football
detail: In football, teams of 11 players compete to score goals by advancing the ball into their opponent's goal. Since all that's needed to play is a ball, the sport is enjoyed worldwide on every continent.

name: Golf
detail: Golf consists of striking a ball into a series of holes using a selection of clubs and counting the number of strokes it takes to do so.

name: Karate
detail: Karate's quest to secure a place on the Olympic programme dates back to the 1970s.

name: Shooting
detail: In shooting, there are three disciplines; rifle and pistol where athletes shoot at stationary targets in a range and shotgun which involves hitting moving targets.

name: Swimming
detail: Swimmers compete to achieve the fastest time while covering a designated distance using a predetermined stroke (freestyle, backstroke, breaststroke or butterfly).

name: Taekwondo
detail: For some 2,000 years, a range of martial arts were practised on the Korean peninsula. During the early 20th century, taekwondo became the dominant form of martial art practised in Korea.

name: Tennis
detail: Tennis appeared at the first modern Olympic Games in 1896 but was dropped from the programme after the Paris 1924 Games.

name: Volleyball
detail: Volleyball is played by two teams on a 18m x 9m court divided by a net (2.43m high for men, 2.24m for women). Each team at the Olympic Games is allowed up to 12 players, but only 6 play on court.

name: Weightlifting
detail: Weightlifting as an organised sport also has a long history and was included in the programme at the very first modern Olympic Games, Athens 1896.
